review: I'm a home theater and technology enthusiast trying to simplify my TV and media setup, so keep in mind that bias in the review.  The main reason I purchased the Fire TV Stick was the sale for Amazon Prime users, and my frustration at my setup for the TV in the bedroom.  It works "OK" for the bedroom, but was miserable when I tried it in the Living Room.  I *REALLY* wish Amazon would stick to content delivery and just focus on making sure I could access their content on all devices (Like the Nexus Player, and my Android Tablets).  I haven't been excited by any of their electronics beyond the eInk Kindles, and their insistence on controlling the platform and the content pushed me towards more open platforms.Pros:* Cheap, convenient* Fast interface* Graphically rich interface* Convenient for Prime subscribers* Has a Plex client which looks really goodCons:* Forces you to have multiple remotes.  The included remote is only for the stick, and the stick does not work with IR universal remotes.  For the first time in a LONG time I can't use a single, simple universal remote to control the TV in the bedroom.  In order to get a remote compatible, you'd have to spend >$100 for a Logitech Smart Home Hub setup that supported Bluetooth.* Audio issues with 5.1 or better audio in Plex.  Basically, I can't get it working and the forums are full of complaints.  In contrast, the Audio playback on a Roku is perfect, and almost never needs to be transcoded.* Amazon pushed their content so aggressively it's harder to use for anything else.  So many sections devoted to so much different Amazon content make it cluttered and chaotic.* There is no way to "pin" apps like Netflix or Plex at the top of the home screen, for quick access.  If you watch a lot of Amazon media your other apps will get pushed off of the top of the home screen and you'll have to scroll down and over many clicks to get to the apps again.* While you can sideload other apps, accessing them requires entirely too many clicks to get to a buried menu.* The WiFi prefers 2.4GHz over 5GHz.  Playback was crap until I create a wireless network that was only 5GHz to Force the Fire Stick to use 5Ghz.  Much better performance now, but kind of a pain.* The Amazon Music interface was so inconvenient I stopped even trying to use it.* Limited Apps - No HBO Go (yet - coming soon), no access to Google Play or Google Music.
